TITLE: Here's how much equity U.S. homeowners have lost since May
SUMMARY: As home prices fall, homeowners are losing equity at the fastest pace in over a decade.

TITLE: Consumer confidence in the housing market hits a new low, according to Fannie Mae
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates, high home prices and uncertainty in the overall economy have Americans feeling more pessimistic about the state of the housing market.

TITLE: Most Americans want to 'age in place' at home. Here's how to plan your support systems
SUMMARY: Retirement-focused financial advisors can help with both the financial and non-financial preparations for seniors looking to age in place at home.

TITLE: Weekly mortgage demand flattens, as interest rates climb higher to 7.14%
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates caused mortgage demand to stall last week.

TITLE: Mortgage rates fall sharply to under 7% after inflation eases
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates fell sharply Thursday after a government report showed that inflation had cooled in October.

TITLE: Take a look inside the only large-scale 3D printed housing development in the U.S.
SUMMARY: One of the nation's largest homebuilders, Lennar, is partnering with ICON, a 3D printing company to develop the project.

TITLE: Here’s the inflation breakdown for October 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation rose less than expected in October, but consumer prices are still rising quickly for staples such as energy, food and shelter.

TITLE: Judge appoints independent monitor to oversee Trump Org financial reporting in NY AG fraud suit
SUMMARY: The appointment came as part of NY AG Letitia James' lawsuit alleging widespread fraud by former President Donald Trump, his businesses and his family members.

TITLE: Here's why it may take a while for housing inflation to cool off
SUMMARY: Housing is likely to dampen any improvement in the consumer price index even if inflation eases in coming months.

TITLE: Inflation expectations rebounded in October on record-high jump in gas outlook, NY Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Americans grew more worried about inflation in the October, with fears emanating primarily from an expected burst in gasoline prices.

TITLE: UK property market at risk of major downturn as recession fears loom
SUMMARY: The U.K. property market may be verging on a major downturn as data points to the biggest slump in demand since the Global Financial Crisis.

TITLE: Microsoft, Meta and others face rising drought risk to their data centers
SUMMARY: Data centers generate massive amounts of heat through their servers because of the enormous amount of power they use, and water is used to cool them.

TITLE: See which states have suffered the most major climate disasters since 2011
SUMMARY: The financial losses resulting from recent climate disasters are greater than the amount of federal funds provided for recovery efforts, the report said.

TITLE: Here's why Home Depot and Lowe's are booming in a housing market bust
SUMMARY: Lowe's and Home Depot are faring well even as the housing market is going through a rough patch.

TITLE: The four-day workweek is new standard for 40% of companies, EY survey finds
SUMMARY: American companies are increasingly adopting a four-day workweek, an EY report found, as they move to expand real estate holdings and improve employee morale.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment drops to a decade low, as builders add more incentives
SUMMARY: Higher costs and lower demand caused homebuilder sentiment to drop to a decade low.

TITLE: Sharp drop in mortgage rates does little to boost demand
SUMMARY: Mortgage application volume rose 2.7% last week compared with the previous week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association.

TITLE: See which states have suffered the most major weather disasters since 2011
SUMMARY: The financial losses resulting from recent climate disasters are greater than the amount of federal funds provided for recovery efforts, the report said.

TITLE: Rent growth slows to the lowest level in 18 months
SUMMARY: Rents in October rose 4.7% compared with October 2021, the slowest annual increase in 18 months, according to Realtor.com.

TITLE: FTX used corporate funds to purchase employee homes, new filing shows
SUMMARY: Corporate funds were used by FTX to purchase homes for the benefit of employees, a bankruptcy filing from new CEO John Ray III said.

TITLE: Home sales fell for the ninth straight month in October, as higher mortgage rates scared off potential buyers
SUMMARY: Home sales weakened for the ninth straight month in October, weighed down by higher mortgage rates.

TITLE: Buyers need a six-figure income to afford a 'typical' home, report finds. Here's how to reduce the cost
SUMMARY: In October, home buyers needed to earn $107,281 to afford the median monthly mortgage payment for a "typical home." Here's how to reduce the cost.

TITLE: Chinese real estate stocks surged this month. But analyst warns of  'weak reality' vs. high expectations
SUMMARY: China's recent real estate measures don't directly resolve the industry's main problem of falling home sales and prices.

TITLE: Investors' home purchases drop 30% as price increases slow down
SUMMARY: Investor home purchases dropped just over 30% in the third quarter of this year compared with the same period last year, according to Redfin.

TITLE: The future of parking is in New York — and it costs at least $300,000 per space
SUMMARY: Hidden deep below some of New York City's most luxurious apartment buildings is an exclusive world of futuristic parking spaces.

TITLE: Mortgage demand rises 2.2% as interest rates decline slightly
SUMMARY: Mortgage applications rose for the week, but were still far below last year's levels.

TITLE: German property market will slow — but no significant correction ahead, central bank says
SUMMARY: Claudia Buch, vice president of the Bundesbank, told CNBC there had not been a reversal of the "overall dynamic" in the housing market.
